defaultCourse1.title: Introduction to Informatics
defaultCourse1.explanation_recommendation: Introduction to Informatics: Covers essential computer science concepts including algorithms, data structures, and programming, matching TUM's expectations.

defaultCourse2.title: Fundamentals of Programming (Exercises & Laboratory)
defaultCourse2.explanation_recommendation: Introduction to Programming (INF-EiP): Adequately covers programming concepts such as recursion, basic data structures, and object-oriented programming.

defaultCourse3.title: Introduction to Computer Organization and Technology - Computer Architecture
defaultCourse3.explanation_recommendation: Computer Architecture (INF-RA): Has basic concepts but lacks depth in VHDL circuit design compared to TUM's expectations.

defaultCourse4.title: Introduction to Software Engineering
defaultCourse4.explanation_recommendation: Software Engineering (INF-SWT): Covers UML, software design patterns, and process models as expected by TUM.

defaultCourse5.title: Operating Systems and System Software
defaultCourse5.explanation_recommendation: Operating Systems (INF-BS): Provides a good understanding of OS concepts and resource management aligning with TUM's curriculum.

defaultCourse6.title: Fundamentals of Algorithms and Data Structures
defaultCourse6.explanation_recommendation: Algorithms and Data Structures (INF-AlDs): Equips learners with essential algorithmic skills and data structure knowledge as per TUM standards.

defaultCourse7.title: Fundamentals of Databases
defaultCourse7.explanation_recommendation: Database Systems I (INF-DBSI): Covers database design and SQL comprehensively as anticipated by the module.

defaultCourse8.title: Computer Networking and IT Security
defaultCourse8.explanation_recommendation: Computer Networks and Distributed Systems (INF-RVS): Complements TUM's course by addressing networking layers and security concepts.

defaultCourse9.title: Information Theory and Theoretical Informatics
defaultCourse9.explanation_recommendation: Formal Languages and Complexity Theory (INF-FSK): Adequately covers topics such as automata theory and complexity classes as required.

defaultCourse10.title: Introduction to Signal Processing
defaultCourse10.explanation_recommendation: Signal Analysis: Less ECTS earned, missing in-depth treatment of digital image processing concepts.

defaultCourse11.title: Foundations of Cyber-Physical Systems
defaultCourse11.explanation_recommendation: No equivalent course found in applicant's curriculum.

defaultCourse12.title: Enterprise Architecture Management and Reference Models
defaultCourse12.explanation_recommendation: No equivalent course found in applicant's curriculum.

defaultCourse13.title: Business Process Management
defaultCourse13.explanation_recommendation: Business Process Management: Exposes students to understanding process modeling and analysis matching TUM's requirement.

defaultCourse14.title: Discrete Structures
defaultCourse14.explanation_recommendation: Logic and Discrete Structures (INF-LDS): Partial matching; does not cover advanced algorithmic applications as deeply as required.

defaultCourse15.title: Linear Algebra
defaultCourse15.explanation_recommendation: Linear Algebra for Computer Scientists (MA-LinAlgICS): Doesn't fully delve into advanced determinant theories and eigenvalue implications.

defaultCourse16.title: Calculus
defaultCourse16.explanation_recommendation: Calculus 1 and 2: Covers both single and multivariable calculus comprehensively equivalent to TUM's expectancy.

defaultCourse17.title: Discrete Probability Theory
defaultCourse17.explanation_recommendation: Introduction to Probability Calculus and Inductive Statistics (STAT-EWIDS): Extensively covers probability and statistics as per TUM's benchmark.
